workflow.name: Automated error handling with email alerts & smart workflow deactivation
workflow.description:
## How it works

This workflow **automatically handles errors** in your n8n workflows by:

1. Detecting when an error occurs and capturing the error details
2. Sending an email notification with the error message and affected node
3. Allowing you to deactivate the workflow or ignore the error via email response
4. Optionally rerouting the error notification to another user for approval

The workflow includes two templates: a **basic version** with simple deactivate/ignore options, and an **advanced version** that allows error rerouting to a second user.

## Set up steps

**Estimated time: 5-10 minutes**

You'll need to configure **SMTP credentials** for sending emails, set up **n8n API** access for workflow management, and update email addresses and workflow URLs throughout the nodes. Choose which template (basic or reroute logic) fits your needs, then activate the workflow to start monitoring for errors.

parameters.message:
=An error has occurred in your workflow with this message: {{ $json.error_message }}

Node: {{ $json.node_with_error }}
parameters.subject: Error in Workflow

=An error has occurred in your workflow with this message: {{ $json.error_message }}

Node: {{ $json.node_with_error }}
parameters.subject: Error in Workflow
Error in Shared Workflow
parameters.toEmail: ={{ $('Inform User & Wait for Response').item.json["Reroute Error Message"] }}

parameters.content:
## SMTP Email Setup

### Gmail (Recommended)
1. **Get App Password**: Google Account ‚Üí Security ‚Üí 2-Step Verification ‚Üí App passwords
   - Create one named "n8n" and save the 16-character password
2. **Add to n8n**: Settings ‚Üí Credentials ‚Üí Create New ‚Üí "SMTP"
   - **User**: your.email@gmail.com  
   - **Password**: The app password (not your regular password)
   - **Host**: smtp.gmail.com | **Port**: 587 | **Security**: STARTTLS
3. **Apply**: Select this credential in all Email Send nodes and update the email addresses

### Other Providers
- **Outlook**: smtp-mail.outlook.com, Port 587
- **Yahoo**: smtp.mail.yahoo.com, Port 587

## n8n API Setup

1. **Create Token**: Settings ‚Üí Personal API tokens ‚Üí Create API token
   - Name it "Error Handler" and **copy the token immediately**
2. **Add Credential**: Settings ‚Üí Credentials ‚Üí Create New ‚Üí "n8n"
   - **API Key**: Paste your token
   - **Base URL**: Your n8n instance URL (e.g., https://your-instance.n8n.cloud)
3. **Update Workflow IDs**: In each "Deactivate" node, change "yourworkflows.url" to the actual workflow ID you want to monitor

## Quick Test
Send yourself a test email using an Email Send node to verify SMTP works, then test the n8n API by listing your workflows.

## Common Issues
- **Gmail not working?** Use App Password, not regular password
- **Can't deactivate workflows?** Check your API token has write permissions
- **Wrong workflow being deactivated?** Verify the workflow ID in the n8n nodes

## Links
- [SMTP Setup Guide](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.emailsend/)
- [n8n API Guide](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.n8n/)

## Choose Your Template
The workflow includes two options:
- **Basic Template (Top)**: Simple Deactivate/Ignore choice via email
- **Advanced Template (Bottom)**: Adds rerouting to another person + custom form

Pick one and delete the other nodes to keep things clean.

## Connect to Your Target Workflow
1. **Import this error handler** into your n8n instance
2. **Open your main workflow** (the one that might fail)
3. **Add Error Trigger connection**: 
   - Go to workflow settings ‚Üí Error Workflow
   - Select this error handling workflow from the dropdown
4. **Update the workflow IDs** in the "Deactivate" nodes to point to your main workflow

## Activate and Test
1. **Activate your main workflow with a temporary cron trigger**
2. **Create a test failure** in your main workflow:
   - Add a temporary HTTP node with invalid URL like `https://fake-url-that-fails.com`
   - Or use a Set node with invalid expression like `{{ $invalidReference }}`
3. **Let your main workflow run automatically** - it should fail and trigger the error handler
4. **Check your email** and test both response options
5. **Remove the test failure** once everything works

## What Happens When Errors Occur
1. Your main workflow fails ‚Üí Error handler automatically runs
2. You get an email with error details and response options
3. **If you choose "Deactivate"**: Workflow stops, you get confirmation email
4. **If you choose "Ignore"**: Workflow stays active (error was temporary/acceptable)
5. **Advanced template**: You can forward the decision to someone else via email

## Pro Tips
- **Test with non-critical workflows first** to get familiar with the process
- **Set up email filters** to ensure error notifications don't go to spam
- **Use the rerouting feature** for shared workflows where multiple people should be able to handle errors
- **Monitor your email** - some errors need immediate attention while others can wait

Build your own virtual assistant with n8n: A step by step guide

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.

generic.label: Creating Error Workflows in n8n

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
